tasks.task: Preparing garden for spring planting in a cold climate.
subtasks: Checking current garden conditions (e.g., plant health, temperature).
Monitoring winter sown seedlings (e.g., calendula, sweet peas, basil).
Protecting seedlings from frost (e.g., using mini greenhouses or covers).
Delaying planting of sensitive plants (e.g., tomatoes, peppers) until warmer nights.
Preparing garden beds for upcoming planting seasons (e.g., clearing, mulching).
Monitoring weather forecasts for temperature predictions.
Protecting existing plants (e.g., ground cherries, onions) from frost.
Adjusting garden structures (e.g., closing garden doors at night).
Using temperature data to guide planting decisions.
Planning future garden tasks during the waiting period (e.g., dandelion picking).
Educating viewers about climate considerations in spring gardening.
